verses.verse: On the Day 1 after the Sabbaths at deep daybreak, they and some women together with them came on the grave carrying fragrant spices that they got ready.
But they found the stone that had been rolled away from the burial vault.
And when they went in, they did not find the body of the Master, Jesus.
And it happened during the time for them to be dumbfounded about this; and look, two men stood over them in outfits that were bright.
When they became afraid, even tilting their face to the ground, the men said to them, "Why are you looking for the living with the dead?
He is not here, but He was gotten up. Remember how He spoke to you as He was still in Galilee,
saying, 'It is necessary for the Son of the Person to be turned over into sinful people's hands, to be nailed to a cross, and to stand up on the third day'?"
They remembered His statements.
And when they returned from the burial vault, they reported all these things to the eleven and all the rest.
They were the Magdalene Mary, Joanna, Mary (the mother of James), and the rest of the women together with them, who were telling these things to the missionaries.
And their statements appeared in their sight as if it were nonsense, and they were not trusting them.
But when Peter got up, he ran up to the burial vault. And when he stooped and peered in, he saw the linen strips lying alone. And he went off to himself, amazed at what happened.
And look, two from among them were traveling in the same day to a village having itself sixty track laps (7.5 miles) away from Jerusalem to which belongs the name Emmaus.
And they were chatting to each other about all these things that had transpired.
And it happened during the time for them to be chatting and to be posing questions; after Jesus Himself came near, He also was traveling together with them.
Their eyes were being held on to, of the "not to recognize Him" kind.
He said to them, "What are these words that you are throwing back and forth to each other as you traipse around and are sad-faced?"
When the one with whom is the name Cleopas answered, he said to Him, "Are you just a local foreigner in Jerusalem? And didn't you know the things that happened in it in these days?"

And He said to them, "What kind of things?" The two said to Him, "The things about Jesus, the Nazarene, a man who became a preacher, competent in action and message directly in front of God and all the ethnic group,
and how the head priests and our head people turned Him over to a sentence of death and nailed Him to a cross.

We were anticipating that He is the One who is going to be paying the price to release Israel. But, definitely, together with all these things, it leads this third day, today, from the time that these things happened.
But also some women from among us astounded us who became daybreaking women on the burial vault.
And when they did not find His body, they came, saying to have also seen a sighting of angels that say for Him to be alive.
And some of the people together with us went off up to the burial vault and this is how they found it, just as also the women said, but they did not see Him."
And He said to them, "O unobservant people and slow with the heart of the 'to be trusting based on all the things that the preachers spoke' thing.
Was it not necessary for the Anointed King to suffer these things and to go into His magnificence?"
And beginning from Moses and from all the Preachers, He thoroughly interpreted to them the things about Himself in all the Old Testament writings.
And they were near to the village where they were traveling to, and He was pretending to be traveling farther.
And they compelled Him, saying, "Stay with us because it is close to late afternoon and the day has declined down." And He went in for the purpose to stay together with them.
And it happened during the time for Him to be reclined with them; after taking the bread, He conferred prosperity on it, and after tearing it, He was giving it over to them.
Their eyes were completely opened, they recognized Him, and He became unappearing away from them.
And they said to each other, "Was our heart not burning in us as He was speaking to us on the road, as He was completely opening the Old Testament writings to us?"
And after standing up the same hour, they returned to Jerusalem, and they found the eleven and the people who had accumulated together with them,
who said that the Master really was gotten up and was seen by Simon.
And they were recounting the things on the road and how He was known to them in the tearing of the bread.
As they were speaking these things, Jesus stood in the middle of them. And He says to them, "Peace to you."
After being scared and becoming afraid, they were seeming to be seeing a spirit.
And He said to them, "Why have you been uneasy? And why do questions step up in your hearts?
Look at my hands and my feet because I am Me, Myself. Feel Me and look because a spirit does not have a physical body and bones just as you see Me having."
And after He said this, He showed them His hands and feet.
While they still did not trust out of the happiness and being amazed, He said to them, "What edible thing do you have here?"
The students gave a part of cooked fish over to Him and a piece out of a honeycomb.
And after taking it, He ate it in their sight.

He said to them, "These are the words that I spoke to you as I was still together with you, 'It is necessary for all the things that have been written in the Law of Moses, the Preachers, and Psalms about Me to be accomplished.'"
At that time, He completely opened their way of thinking for the "to be understanding the Old Testament writings" part.
And He said to them, "This is how it has been written, and this is how it is necessary for the Anointed King to suffer, to come back to life from the dead the third day,
and to speak publicly based on His name about a change of ways and forgiveness of sins for all the nations beginning out from Jerusalem.
You are witnesses of these things.
And look, I am sending the promise of My Father out on you. You must be seated in the city of Jerusalem until the time that you will put on ability from a high position."
He led them outside until they came to Bethany, and when He raised up His hands, He conferred prosperity on them.
And it happened during the time for Him to be conferring prosperity on them; He stood further away from them and was being carried up into the sky.
And they, after bowing down to Him, returned to Jerusalem with great happiness.
And through everything they were on the temple grounds praising and conferring prosperity on God. Amen.
